result.execSummary:
The defendant Terry E Young was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Terry E Young in court with attorney Brian B. Burke.  Patrick D. Winter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Court admonished defendant for non-compliance and ordered defendant to serve 5 days of the condition time; RELEASE FOR WORK, COUNSELING AND TREATMENT; forthwith.  Commitment For Condition Time For Non-Compliance With Probation Conditions - Domestic Violence Court signed and filed.
Probation Review Hearing scheduled for 10-09-2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Terry E Young in court with attorney Joel Alan Mogren.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense counsel and defendant as to sentencing.

As to Count 1:
Court ordered defendant to serve 9  MONTHS in the House of Correction consecutive to any sentence; credit for 4 days served.

As to Count 2:
Court ordered defendant to serve 3  MONTHS in the House of Correction consecutive to any sentence; credit for Zero days served.

As to both counts:
Court STAYED the sentence and placed defendant on probation for  2  YEARS  with the following conditions:

- Court ordered 60 days in the House of Correction; stayed for the use at the discretion of the probation department.
- Successfully complete a BIP training program
- Comply with any treatment or programming ordered by probation
- Successfully complete a Parenting class
- AODA assessment; comply with any treatment.
- Absolute Sobriety
- Random screens
- No drugs without a valid prescription
- No contact with the victim 
- Court sets Restitution at $0 (zero)
- Seek/maintain employment.
- Pay all costs, fees, assessments and surcharges during the term of probation.  Any cash bail posted on this case to be applied to costs and surcharges owed.
  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment
- No contact with firearms
- Attend the probation review hearing on 10-09-2015

Received and filed:  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.
Clerk:  jms

Defendant Terry E Young in court with attorney Joel Alan Mogren.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
AS TO AMENDED COUNT #1 and COUNT 2: Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information/Complaint. Judgment of conviction entered.  Statement made by Tamika M.  Case adjourned for Sentencing Hearing in Branch 4 on 7-2-2015 at 8:30 am.  All conditions of bail are continued, including no contact with Tamika M., and no guns in possession, until further order of the Court.   mld
Court added weapons and no guns as a condition of bail.   mld

Defendant Terry E Young in court with attorney Joel Alan Mogren.  Evan Glaberson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense counsel confirmed that defendant had appeared in family court on another case on the afternoon of 2-9-2015.  Court withdraws warrant.  Defense counsel received discovery and offer on 2-9-2015.  All conditions of bail are continued, including no contact with Tamika M., and no violations of the law.  Court added no weaons or guns as a condition of bail.   Case adjourned for Jury Trial in Branch 4 on 6-10-2015 at 8:30 am.   mld

Defendant appeared before the Court at 4:05 pm., and stated that he was in another court this afternoon, on case 2015FA459.  Clerk instructed defendant to return tomorrow morning, 2-10-2015, at 8:30 am, branch 4, to clear warrant.   mld
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT.

Attorney Joel Alan Mogren appeared earlier in court.  Evan Glaberson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Case called at 2:52 pm.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to issue.  mld

15RM004621  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
01-31-2015

No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Tamika M.

Defendant Terry E Young in court with attorney Michael B Plaisted.  Defendant Terry E Young in custody.  David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  HP
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Flanagan, Branch 04.  Defense moved to dismiss the weapons enhancer as to Count 1.  Motion granted, weapons enhancer as to Count 1 dismissed. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 9, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
